scenario: Berkshire Hathaway's (BRK.B) largest holding after Apple is American Express (AXP), with the company holding on to its shares despite a 58% rise in 2024. American Express has a unique business model that has enabled it to grow earnings at a high rate, with 28% year-over-year earnings per share (EPS) growth in the trailing-nine-month period ended September 30, 2024. The company's earnings growth has been fueled by strong credit and operating leverage, with management raising its guidance for full-year EPS. American Express' revenue growth rate of 9% is lower than the 14% growth achieved in 2023, but the company benefits from different growth levers simultaneously, including 6% growth in card member spending, 18% growth in card fee revenue, and a 17% increase in net interest income. The stock's price-to-earnings ratio is 22, and its forward P/E is 20, making it an attractive long-term investment as part of a diversified portfolio.
